graph.original_query: Who won the T20 Under-19 World Cup?

From Virat Kohli to Ayush Mhatre: Check Under-19 World Cup winners list as India beat England in 2026 final | Cricket News - The Times of India Edition IN IN US English English     Weather Sign In TOI Under-19 WC Schedule Points Table Teams Today's ePaper News Sports News Cricket News From Virat Kohli to Ayush Mhatre: Check Under-19 World Cup winners list as India beat England in 2026 final Trending Rishabh Pant Ben Stokes IND vs ENG U19 World Cup Live Score Pakistan Cricket Board WPL 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Schedule Suryakumar Yadav Smriti Mandhana Rohit Sharma ICC T20 World Cup Points Table Rishabh Pant Ben Stokes IND vs ENG U19 World Cup Live Score Pakistan Cricket Board WPL 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Schedule Suryakumar Yadav Smriti Mandhana Rohit Sharma ICC T20 World Cup Points Table Rishabh Pant Ben Stokes IND vs ENG U19 World Cup Live Score Pakistan Cricket Board WPL 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Schedule Suryakumar Yadav Smriti Mandhana Rohit Sharma ICC T20 World Cup Points Table From Virat Kohli to Ayush Mhatre: Check Under-19 World Cup winners list as India beat England in 2026 final TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Feb 06, 2026, 22:16 IST Comments Share AA + Text Size Small Medium Large India U19 men's cricket team (Photo by @BCCI on X) NEW DELHI: India U19 crowned themselves champions of the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026 for a record-extending sixth time after defeating England U19 by 100 runs in the final at Harare Sports Club on Friday, sealing the title in emphatic fashion. Batting first after winning the toss, India piled on a massive 411 for 9 in their 50 overs, driven by a breathtaking knock from Vaibhav Sooryavanshi. T20 World Cup Groups Explained: Who Can Reach the Super 8 The teenage opener smashed 175 off just 80 balls, hammering 15 fours and 15 sixes to completely dominate Englands bowling. Captain Ayush Mhatre added a composed half-century, while late fireworks from Kanishk Chouhan ensured India crossed the 400 mark. Chasing a daunting target, England fought hard but never truly got ahead of the asking rate. Ben Dawkins and Ben Mayes provided early resistance, while Caleb Falconer kept England alive with an aggressive knock of 115. However, regular wickets in the middle overs slowed the chase. Indias bowlers shared the workload, with Deepesh Devendran picking up multiple wickets and Ayush Mhatre and Kanishk Chouhan striking at key moments. England eventually finished on 311 all out in 40.2 overs, falling well short as India completed a dominant win to lift the trophy. The victory marks another milestone for Indias rich Under-19 legacy. ICC U19 Mens World Cup Winners List (hosts mentioned in the bracket) 1988 (Australia): Australia Captain: Geoff Parker 1998 (South Africa): England Captain: Owais Shah 2000 (Sri Lanka): India Captain: Mohammad Kaif 2002 (New Zealand): Australia Captain: Cameron White 2004 (Bangladesh): Pakistan Captain: Khalid Latif 2006 (Sri Lanka): Pakistan Captain: Sarfaraz Ahmed 2008 (Malaysia): India Captain: Virat Kohli 2010 (New Zealand): Australia Captain: Mitchell Marsh 2012 (Australia): India Captain: Unmukt Chand 2014 (UAE): South Africa Captain: Aiden Markram 2016 (Bangladesh): West Indies Captain: Shimron Hetmyer 2018 (New Zealand): India Captain: Prithvi Shaw 2020 (South Africa): Bangladesh Captain: Towhid Hridoy 2022 (West Indies): India Captain: Yash Dhull 2024 (South Africa): Australia Captain: Hugh Weibgen 2026 (Zimbabwe): India Captain: Ayush Mhatre Get the latest ICC Mens T20 World Cup 2026 updates, including the full schedule , teams , live scores , points table , and key series stats such as top run-scorers and wicket-takers. About the Author TOI Sports Desk At TOI Sports Desk, reporters work around the clock to bring you comprehensive updates from the world of sports. Expect nuanced match reports, previews, and reviews, along with statistics-based technical analysis, the latest social media trends, and expert insights across cricket, football, ten

Under-19 World Cup Winners & Runner Ups List (1988 to 2026) Skip to content Home About Contact Us IPL Betting Apps Blog View Certificate Main Menu Home About Contact Us IPL Betting Apps Blog Cricket Under-19 World Cup Winners & Runner Ups List (1988 to 2026) January 21, 2026 Written By: Devraj Chauhan Australia and India have defined the ICC Under-19 World Cup era, winning five titles each and accounting for nearly two-thirds of all championships. Together, they have featured in 13 finals and consistently produced players who later excelled at the senior international level, setting global standards in youth development. Australia displayed its dominance with decisive final victories, winning by 113 runs in 2002 and by 79 runs in 2024. India stands out for its consistency, reaching 9 finals and lifting trophies under diverse conditions, including overseas triumphs in 2012 and 2022. This article reviews all 15 finals from 1988 to 2024, illustrating how junior success shapes long-term international excellence. Complete List of ICC Under-19 World Cup Winners In this table, the complete list of ICC Under-19 World Cup winners is presented by year and team. Source: News18 Season Winner Runners-up Host Country 1987/88 Australia Under-19 Pakistan Under-19 Australia 1997/98 England Under-19 New Zealand Under-19 South Africa 1999/00 India Under-19 Sri Lanka Under-19 Sri Lanka 2001/02 Australia Under-19 South Africa Under-19 New Zealand 2003/04 Pakistan Under-19 West Indies Under-19 Bangladesh 2005/06 Pakistan Under-19 India Under-19 Sri Lanka 2007/08 India Under-19 South Africa Under-19 Malaysia 2009/10 Australia Under-19 Pakistan Under-19 New Zealand 2012 India Under-19 Australia Under-19 Australia 2013/14 South Africa Under-19 Pakistan Under-19 United Arab Emirates 2015/16 West Indies Under-19 India Under-19 Bangladesh 2017/18 India Under-19 Australia Under-19 New Zealand 2019/20 Bangladesh Under-19 India Under-19 South Africa 2021/22 India Under-19 England Under-19 West Indies 2023/24 Australia Under-19 India Under-19 South Africa Source: ESPNcricinfo 1. 1987/88 Australia Australia won the inaugural McDonalds Bicentennial Youth World Cup by defeating Pakistan by 5 wickets in the final at Adelaide on 13 March 1988. Batting first, Pakistan Young Cricketers scored 201, showing resistance but failing to accelerate in the final overs of their 50-over innings. Source: ESPNcricinfo Chasing 202, Australia responded calmly, reaching 202/5 in 45.5 overs with 25 balls to spare, showcasing superior game management. Brett Williams was the standout, scoring a match-defining 108 off 134 balls and earning Player of the Match. His century remains one of the earliest iconic knocks in U19 World Cup finals history, marking Australias first youth world title and setting the stage for long-term dominance. 2. 1997/98 England England claimed their only ICC Under-19 Cricket World Cup title by defeating New Zealand Under-19s by 7 wickets in the final at Johannesburg on 1 February 1998. Batting first, New Zealand scored 241/6, relying on steady top-order contributions without late acceleration. Source: ESPNcricinfo Chasing 242, England reached 242/3 in 46 overs with 24 balls remaining, showcasing controlled, mature batting under pressure. Stephen Peters earned Player of the Match with a composed 107 off 125 balls, anchoring the chase. Englands strong partnerships and calm finishing reflected the strength of their youth system, producing future county cricket regulars and marking a rare, significant triumph. 3. 1999/00 India India secured their maiden ICC Under-19 Cricket World Cup title by defeating Sri Lanka Under-19s by 6 wickets in the final at Sinhalese Sports Club, Colombo, on 28 January 2000. Batting first, Sri Lanka were bowled out for 178, struggling against Indias disciplined bowling in the middle overs. Chasing 179, India reached 180/4 in 40.4 overs with 56 balls remaining, displaying calm composure. Reetinder Sodhi earned Player of the Match with

nodes.description: Retrieve information about the T20 Under-19 World Cup winner.
nodes.agent_prompt: Search for the winner of the T20 Under-19 World Cup. Provide the name of the winning team and the year of the tournament.

nodes.description: Format the T20 Under-19 World Cup winner information.
nodes.agent_prompt: Format the provided information about the T20 Under-19 World Cup winner into a clear and concise statement. Include the winning team and the year. The output should be direct and without motivational language.

nodes.description: Retrieve information about the T20 Under-19 World Cup winner.
nodes.agent_prompt: Search for the winner of the T20 Under-19 World Cup. Provide the name of the winning team and the year of the tournament.

code_variants.CODE_1A:
results = json.loads(search_web_with_text_content('T20 Under-19 World Cup winner', 5))
return {'world_cup_winner_info_T001': results}
code_variants.CODE_1B:
urls = json.loads(web_search('T20 Under-19 Cricket World Cup winner year', 5))
return {'world_cup_winner_info_T001': urls}

Login Now Well written content Worth the read Captivating and insightful Brilliantly explained ICC Under-19 World Cup Winners List (1988 - 2026) By Mrigank Chakraborty Feb 6, 2026, 22:52 IST Under-19 World Cup Winners List: India lifted their 6th U-19 World Cup title by defeating England by 100 runs on 6th February 2026. Check the complete list of Under-19 World Cup Winners along with the runners-up here! Add as a preferred source on Google Join us Under 19 World Cup Winners List (1988 - 2026) The Under-19 Mens Cricket World Cup is an international cricket tournament organised by the ICC for national U-19 teams across the world. This years ICC U-19 World Cup is hosted by Zimbabwe and Namibia. India won the U-19 World Cup 2026 final, defeating England by 100 runs. Check out the U-19 World Cup winners list from 1988 to 2026 here. Who Won the U-19 World Cup 2026? India won the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026 by defeating England in the final by 100 runs. The star of the match was the southpaw Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, who smashed 175 runs in just 80 balls with the help of 15 towering sixes and 15 boundaries. x 6 India defeat England to be crowned ICC Men's #U19WorldCup 2026 winners pic.twitter.com/cECQnOVd3J ICC (@ICC) February 6, 2026 Also Read: Who won the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026? Check Most Runs, Wickets, Player of the Tournament and Prize Money U-19 World Cup Winners (1988-2026) The following is the list of ICC U-19 World Cup Winners from its inception in 1988 till 2026. Year Champions Runner-Up 2026 India England 2024 Australia India 2022 India England 2020 Bangladesh India 2018 India Australia 2016 West Indies India 2014 South Africa Pakistan 2012 India Australia 2010 Australia Pakistan 2008 India South Africa 2006 Pakistan India 2004 Pakistan West Indies 2002 Australia South Africa 2000 India Sri Lanka 1998 England New Zealand 1988 Australia Pakistan Source: ESPNcricinfo T20 World Cup Winners List (2007-2026) Which Team has won the most ICC U-19 World Cups? India has won the most number of U-19 World Cups, with the latest win in 2026. India lifted their 6th U-19 World Cup title. India previously won the U-19 World Cup titles in the year 2022, 2018, 2012, 2008, and 2000. Highest T20 Score: List of Top 10 Highest T20 International Scores How many under-19 World Cups has India won? India has won six U-19 World Cup titles, the most of any team. India lifted the trophy in the years 2000, 2008. 2012, 2018, 2022, and 2026. How many U19 WC Australia won? Australia has won 4 U-19 World Cup titles; they won the 2024 edition by defeating India in the final. The other three titles were won in the years 1988, 2002, and 2010, respectively. How many U-19 World Cup England won? England has won a solitary title in 1998, and since then, they have been chasing the title, with the latest attempt in the 2026 World Cup. But, a 100-run defeat at the hands of India in the 2026 U-19 World Cup Final upset their dreams of a s

Under-19 World Cup 2026: India U-19 vs England U-19, Highlights & Result - Final English Sign in Cricket Icons Live Scores News Cricket News Net Worth Cricket Appeal Analysis Stats Mania Twitter Reactions Social Tracker T20 WC Live Scores News Schedule Stats Points Table WPL Live Scores News Schedule Stats Points Table U19 WC Live Scores News Schedule Stats Points Table Ranji Trophy Live Scores News Schedule Stats Points Table Match Predictions Fantasy Tips Interviews Web Stories Videos Series Schedule Poll More Compare Players Cricket Players ICC Rankings - Men ICC Rankings - Women Home cricket news Under-19 World Cup 2026: India U-19 vs England U-19, Highlights & Result - Final India Under-19 won by 100 runs against England Under-19 on February 06. By Ajay Koushik R Published - 06 Feb 2026, 21:01 IST | Updated - 06 Feb 2026, 21:24 IST 3 Min Read Under-19 World Cup 2026: India U-19 vs England U-19, Highlights & Result - Final (Photo Source: Getty Images) India Under-19 clinched the Under-19 World Cup 2026 title after defeating England Under-19 by 100 runs in the final on February 6 at the Harare Sports Club in Harare. With this victory, India lifted the U19 World Cup trophy for a record sixth time. Batting first, India U19 posted a massive total of 411/9 in their allotted 50 overs. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi starred with a sensational knock of 175 runs, while captain Ayush Mhatre played a crucial supporting role, scoring 53. For England U19, James Minto was the standout bowler, picking up 3/63. In response, England U19 were bowled out for 311 in 40.2 overs despite fighting knocks from Ben Dawkins, who scored 66, and Caleb Falconer, who top-scored with a brilliant 115. Indias bowlers held their nerve, with RS Ambrish leading the attack by claiming 3/56 from his nine overs to seal a comprehensive victory for the Men in Blue. Top batting performances of the match Vaibhav Sooryavanshi Carnage continues as Vaibhav Sooryavanshi brings up 150 in style! The English bowlers have no answers as the Boss Baby is going all guns blazing with towering sixes! ICC Men's #U19WorldCup | FINAL | #INDvENG | LIVE NOW https://t.co/ZFk8pN9tv3 pic.twitter.com/Dkh4YCXOEC Star Sports (@StarSportsIndia) February 6, 2026 India Under-19 opener Vaibhav Sooryavanshi played a sensational knock, scoring a mammoth 175 off just 80 balls, smashing 15 fours and 15 sixes at an astonishing strike rate of 218.75. He put together a 142-run second-wicket partnership off 90 balls with captain Ayush Mhatre and later added 89 runs off 39 balls for the third wicket with Vedant Trivedi to further strengthen Indias commanding total. Top bowling performances of the match RS Ambrish Just the start India needed! #AmbrishRaghuvanshi provides the first breakthrough for India in the Final! FINAL | #INDvENG | LIVE NOW https://t.co/ZFk8pN9tv3 pic.twitter.com/EOBePwOQTG Star Sports (@StarSportsIndia) February 6, 2026 Right-arm pacer RS Ambrish emerged as the standout performer with the ball in the final. He returned impressive figures of 3/56 from nine overs, including one maiden. Ambrish dismissed Joseph Moores, James Minto, and Manny Lumsden to play a key role in guiding India to a memorable victory over England. Records Broken and Major Milestones Achieved Vaibhav Sooryavanshi etched his name in history by becoming the first player to win both the Player of the Final and Player of the Tournament awards in an Under-19 World Cup. With this triumph, India are now the concurrent holders of the Mens T20 World Cup 2024, ICC Champions Trophy 2025, Womens ODI World Cup 2025, Womens Under-19 World Cup 2025, and the Mens Under-19 World Cup 2026. India also secured their sixth Under-19 World Cup title, the most by any country in the history of the tournament. The final between India Under-19 and England Under-19 produced a combined total of 722 runs, the highest match aggregate in Under-19 World Cup history. Indias 100-run victory is the biggest winning margin in an Under-19 World Cup f

Source: ESPNcricinfo Chasing 202, Australia responded calmly, reaching 202/5 in 45.5 overs with 25 balls to spare, showcasing superior game management. Brett Williams was the standout, scoring a match-defining 108 off 134 balls and earning Player of the Match. His century remains one of the earliest iconic knocks in U19 World Cup finals history, marking Australias first youth world title and setting the stage for long-term dominance. 2. 1997/98 England England claimed their only ICC Under-19 Cricket World Cup title by defeating New Zealand Under-19s by 7 wickets in the final at Johannesburg on 1 February 1998. Batting first, New Zealand scored 241/6, relying on steady top-order contributions without late acceleration. Source: ESPNcricinfo Chasing 242, England reached 242/3 in 46 overs with 24 balls remaining, showcasing controlled, mature batting under pressure. Stephen Peters earned Player of the Match with a composed 107 off 125 balls, anchoring the chase. Englands strong partnerships and calm finishing reflected the strength of their youth system, producing future county cricket regulars and marking a rare, significant triumph. 3. 1999/00 India India secured their maiden ICC Under-19 Cricket World Cup title by defeating Sri Lanka Under-19s by 6 wickets in the final at Sinhalese Sports Club, Colombo, on 28 January 2000. Batting first, Sri Lanka were bowled out for 178, struggling against Indias disciplined bowling in the middle overs. Chasing 179, India reached 180/4 in 40.4 overs with 56 balls remaining, displaying calm composure. Reetinder Sodhi earned Player of the Match with

India has won the most number of U-19 World Cups, with the latest win in 2026. India lifted their 6th U-19 World Cup title. India previously won the U-19 World Cup titles in the year 2022, 2018, 2012, 2008, and 2000. Highest T20 Score: List of Top 10 Highest T20 International Scores How many under-19 World Cups has India won? India has won six U-19 World Cup titles, the most of any team. India lifted the trophy in the years 2000, 2008. 2012, 2018, 2022, and 2026. How many U19 WC Australia won? Australia has won 4 U-19 World Cup titles; they won the 2024 edition by defeating India in the final. The other three titles were won in the years 1988, 2002, and 2010, respectively. How many U-19 World Cup England won? England has won a solitary title in 1998, and since then, they have been chasing the title, with the latest attempt in the 2026 World Cup. Under-19 World Cup 2026: India U-19 vs England U-19, Highlights & Result - Final English Sign in Cricket Icons Live Scores News Cricket News Net Worth Cricket Appeal Analysis Stats Mania Twitter Reactions Social Tracker T20 WC Live Scores News Schedule Stats Points Table WPL Live Scores News Schedule Stats Points Table U19 WC Live Scores News Schedule Stats Points Table Ranji Trophy Live Scores News Schedule Stats Points Table Match Predictions Fantasy Tips Interviews Web Stories Videos Series Schedule Poll More Compare Players Cricket Players ICC Rankings - Men ICC Rankings - Women Home cricket news Under-19 World Cup 2026: India U-19 vs England U-19, Highlights & Result - Final India Under-19 won by 100 runs against England Under-19 on February 06. By Ajay Koushik R Published - 06 Feb 2026, 21:01 IST | Updated - 06 Feb 2026, 21:24 IST 3 Min Read Under-19 World Cup 2026: India U-19 vs England U-19, Highlights & Result - Final (Photo Source: Getty Images) India Under-19 clinched the Under-19 World Cup 2026 title after defeating England Under-19 by 100 runs in the final on February 6 at the Harare Sports Club in Harare. With this victory, India lifted the U19 World Cup trophy for a record sixth time. Batting first, India U19 posted a massive total of 411/9 in their allotted 50 overs. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi starred with a sensational knock of 175 runs, while captain Ayush Mhatre played a crucial supporting role, scoring 53. For England U19, James Minto was the standout bowler, picking up 3/63. In response, England U19 were bowled out for 311 in 40.2 overs despite fighting knocks from Ben Dawkins, who scored 66, and Caleb Falconer, who top-scored with a brilliant 115. Indias bowlers held their nerve, with RS Ambrish leading the attack by claiming 3/56 from his nine overs to seal a comprehensive victory for the Men in Blue. Top batting performances of the match Vaibhav Sooryavanshi Carnage continues as Vaibhav Sooryavanshi brings up 150 in style! The English bowlers have no answers as the Boss Baby is going all guns blazing with towering sixes! ICC Men's #U19WorldCup | FINAL | #INDvENG | LIVE NOW https://t.co/ZFk8pN9tv3 pic.twitter.com/Dkh4YCXOEC Star Sports (@StarSportsIndia) February 6, 2026 India Under-19 opener Vaibhav Sooryavanshi played a sensational knock, scoring a mammoth 175 off just 80 balls, smashing 15 fours and 15 sixes at an astonishing strike rate of 218.75. He put together a 142-run second-wicket partnership off 90 balls with captain Ayush Mhatre and later added 89 runs off 39 balls for the third wicket with Vedant Trivedi to further strengthen Indias commanding total. Top bowling performances of the match RS Ambrish Just the start India needed! #AmbrishRaghuvanshi provides the first breakthrough for India in the Final! FINAL | #INDvENG | LIVE NOW https://t.co/ZFk8pN9tv3 pic.twitter.com/EOBePwOQTG Star Sports (@StarSportsIndia) February 6, 2026 Right-arm pacer RS Ambrish emerged as the standout performer with the ball in the final. He returned impressive figures of 3/56 from nine overs, including one maiden. Ambrish dismissed Joseph Moores, James Minto, and Manny Lumsden to play a key role in guiding India to a memorable victory over England. Records Broken and Major Milestones Achieved Vaibhav Sooryavanshi etched his name in history by becoming the first player to win both the Player of the Final and Player of the Tournament awards in an Under-19 World Cup. With this triumph, India are now the concurrent holders of the Mens T20 World Cup 2024, ICC Champions Trophy 2025, Womens ODI World Cup 2025, Womens Under-19 World Cup 2025, and the Mens Under-19 World Cup 2026. India also secured their sixth Under-19 World Cup title, the most by any country in the history of the tournament. The final between India Under-19 and England Under-19 produced a combined total of 722 runs, the highest match aggregate in Under-19 World Cup history. Indias 100-run victory is the biggest winning margin in an Under-19 World Cup f

From Virat Kohli to Ayush Mhatre: Check Under-19 World Cup winners list as India beat England in 2026 final | Cricket News - The Times of India Edition IN IN US English English     Weather Sign In TOI Under-19 WC Schedule Points Table Teams Today's ePaper News Sports News Cricket News From Virat Kohli to Ayush Mhatre: Check Under-19 World Cup winners list as India beat England in 2026 final Trending Rishabh Pant Ben Stokes IND vs ENG U19 World Cup Live Score Pakistan Cricket Board WPL 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Schedule Suryakumar Yadav Smriti Mandhana Rohit Sharma ICC T20 World Cup Points Table Rishabh Pant Ben Stokes IND vs ENG U19 World Cup Live Score Pakistan Cricket Board WPL 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Schedule Suryakumar Yadav Smriti Mandhana Rohit Sharma ICC T20 World Cup Points Table Rishabh Pant Ben Stokes IND vs ENG U19 World Cup Live Score Pakistan Cricket Board WPL 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Schedule Suryakumar Yadav Smriti Mandhana Rohit Sharma ICC T20 World Cup Points Table From Virat Kohli to Ayush Mhatre: Check Under-19 World Cup winners list as India beat England in 2026 final TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Feb 06, 2026, 22:16 IST Comments Share AA + Text Size Small Medium Large India U19 men's cricket team (Photo by @BCCI on X) NEW DELHI: India U19 crowned themselves champions of the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026 for a record-extending sixth time after defeating England U19 by 100 runs in the final at Harare Sports Club on Friday, sealing the title in emphatic fashion. Batting first after winning the toss, India piled on a massive 411 for 9 in their 50 overs, driven by a breathtaking knock from Vaibhav Sooryavanshi. T20 World Cup Groups Explained: Who Can Reach the Super 8 The teenage opener smashed 175 off just 80 balls, hammering 15 fours and 15 sixes to completely dominate Englands bowling. Captain Ayush Mhatre added a composed half-century, while late fireworks from Kanishk Chouhan ensured India crossed the 400 mark. Chasing a daunting target, England fought hard but never truly got ahead of the asking rate. Ben Dawkins and Ben Mayes provided early resistance, while Caleb Falconer kept England alive with an aggressive knock of 115. However, regular wickets in the middle overs slowed the chase. Indias bowlers shared the workload, with Deepesh Devendran picking up multiple wickets and Ayush Mhatre and Kanishk Chouhan striking at key moments. England eventually finished on 311 all out in 40.2 overs, falling well short as India completed a dominant win to lift the trophy. The victory marks another milestone for Indias rich Under-19 legacy. Australia displayed its dominance with decisive final victories, winning by 113 runs in 2002 and by 79 runs in 2024. India stands out for its consistency, reaching 9 finals and lifting trophies under diverse conditions, including overseas triumphs in 2012 and 2022. nodes.description: Format the T20 Under-19 World Cup winner information.
nodes.agent_prompt: Format the provided information about the T20 Under-19 World Cup winner into a clear and concise statement. Include the winning team and the year. The output should be direct and without motivational language.

output.markdown_report:
# ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026: India Clinches Title

**Winner:** India

**Year:** 2026

The India U19 men's cricket team has been crowned champions of the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026. They defeated England U19 in the final match held on Friday, February 6, 2026, at Harare Sports Club.

# ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026: India Clinches Title

**Winner:** India

**Year:** 2026

The India U19 men's cricket team has been crowned champions of the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026. They defeated England U19 in the final match held on Friday, February 6, 2026, at Harare Sports Club.
